title: Friend Got Perma Banned for Asking to Report?
body:
Why did Riot ban my friend for asking in chat to have someone reported?

They were stating racial and homophobic slurs, and my friend called him out for it.

Is there anyway to get his account revoked? It seems kind of unfair especially without a warning.

replies.body:
the rule is you can't ask for reports because people ask for reports over stupid shit constantly, every player is supposed to report every other player for everything cause league of legends is soviet russia

also wrongthink is not permitted and you will be banned for singed support

"also wrongthink is not permitted and you will be banned for singed support"

I don't understand this part?
long story short, riot has banned people for picking off meta in the past

Don't listen to him on that part =.= Since then Riot has overturned bans like that. The thing is that the strategy the people were using looked a lot like trolling and their teammates overwhelmingly reported for it.

The players in question were using Singed and Nunu as support, taking smite, and counter jungling the entire game, leaving their adc to solo lane. This strategy had positive win rates but made their own team pretty upset. Since then Riot has said that if you are using a strategy like that you need to explain it to your team pre game and if your team requests you not to use it to listen to them or something like that.
*The strategy had a negative winrate in the support Singed case. He was using normal picks to keep his rank, between the losses with Singed.
Saying your report someone in a match is harassing the player which would be toxic. You can just report the player after the match and not have to say anything.

If they received a permanent ban, they definitely had a warning, more than one in-fact assuming their behavior wasn't so incredibly toxic that it warranted an instant permanent ban. It is possible to skip to a Two Week or Permanent suspension based on the severity of the behavior in the game. There are different tiers of punishments, and they generally follow this path:

* First Offense: 10 Game Chat Restriction
* Second Offense: 25 Game Chat Restriction
* Third Offense: Two Week Suspension
* Fourth Offense: Permanent Suspension

If they had a prior two week suspension, any further violations that warrant punishment will result in a permanent suspension, no matter how minor the violation is. Sounds to me like they did more than simply asking a teammate to report someone though. 

Maybe you could ask them to make a post on the boards themselves and include their chat logs? We could help get to the bottom of this and see if it was really warranted or a mistake.
Question, when a player is calling the enemy team racial slurs, such as the n-word, and "gay", is it wrong to call that player a racist homophobe?

Believe it or not, yes, though I'm willing to bet that isn't all that was said. Every player is responsible for their own actions as well as what they do or don't say, regardless of anyone else's behavior. While it's unfortunate that they had to deal with someone like that, it doesn't give them the right to stoop to their level and start calling them names or insulting them back. The best option in these situations is -always- to mute the offending player and report them after the game.

Have your friend come on the forums and post the chat log. Riot doesn't actually punish for asking for reports IF that is the only thing they said that could be construed as negative. If it's bundled with flaming and harassing and what not... then they're going to get punished for jumping off the asking for the report and flaming and harassing.
